spanishExample: ¿Entiendes que si no tenemos catorce vidas morimos?
englishTranslation: Do you understand that if we don’t have fourteen lives we die?
vocabIncluded: "que", meaning "that" as a conjunction (even in cases where "that" disappears in English)
entiendes: understand, you understand (Entender, present, 2nd person)
morimos: die, we die (Morir, present, 1st person plural)

spanishExample: Creo que no entienden que trece es mala suerte, catorce es mejor.
englishTranslation: I think they don’t understand that thirteen is bad luck, fourteen is better.
vocabIncluded: "que", meaning "that" as a conjunction (even in cases where "that" disappears in English)
creo: believe, I believe (Creer, present, 1st person)
entienden: understand, they understand (Entender, present, 3rd person plural)

spanishExample: Di una orden y ellos murieron.
englishTranslation: I gave an order and they died.
vocabIncluded: murieron: died, they died (Morir, preterite, 3rd person plural)

spanishExample: Entendieron que cuatro por tres eran quince y no doce.
englishTranslation: They understood that four times three was fifteen and not twelve.
vocabIncluded: "que", meaning "that" as a conjunction (even in cases where "that" disappears in English)
entendieron: understood, they understood (Entender, preterite, 3rd person plural)

spanishExample: Entendió que me muero por hacerlo.
englishTranslation: He understood that I’m dying to do it.
vocabIncluded: "que", meaning "that" as a conjunction (even in cases where "that" disappears in English)
entendió: understood, he/she/it understood (Entender, preterite, 3rd person)
morirse: any use of morir with a reflexive pronoun, changing the meaning to to die)
muero: die, I die (Morir, present, 1st person)

spanishExample: Entendiste que les hacía falta dinero.
englishTranslation: You understood they were in need of money.
vocabIncluded: "que", meaning "that" as a conjunction (even in cases where "that" disappears in English)
entendiste: understood, you understood (Entender, preterite, 2nd person)
hacía: "was doing/making", "he/she/it was doing/making" (Hacer, imperfect, 3rd person)
le hace falta: in need of something (idiom)
les: "them" as an indirect object ("to them", "for them")

spanishExample: Es una orden, tienes que estar aquí a las doce en punto.
englishTranslation: It’s an order, you have to be here at twelve o’clock.
vocabIncluded: using Tener with "que" to indicate obligation

spanishExample: Estoy muriendo, porque no has entendido.
englishTranslation: I’m dying, because you haven’t understood.
vocabIncluded: has: "have", "you have" before a participle (Haber, present, 2nd person)

spanishExample: Le hacen falta cinco más.
englishTranslation: He is in need of five more.
vocabIncluded: le hace falta: in need of something (idiom)

spanishExample: Morí por la maldición trece veces.
englishTranslation: I died because of the curse thirteen times.
vocabIncluded: morí: died, I died (Morir, preterite, 1st person)

spanishExample: No entendí el sueño que tuve ayer, pero ahora lo entiendo.
englishTranslation: I didn’t understand the dream I had yesterday, but I understand it now.
vocabIncluded: entendí: understood, I understood (Entender, preterite, 1st person)
entiendo: understand, I understand (Entender, present, 1st person)

spanishExample: No entendimos que tres por dos eran seis.
englishTranslation: We didn’t understand that three times two was six.
vocabIncluded: "que", meaning "that" as a conjunction (even in cases where "that" disappears in English)
entendimos: understood, we understood (Entender, preterite, 1st person plural)

spanishExample: No ha muerto, porque si él muere, ellos mueren.
englishTranslation: He hasn’t died, because if he dies they die.
vocabIncluded: ha: "has", "he/she/it has" before a participle (Haber, present, 3rd person)
muere: dies, he/she/it dies (Morir, present, 3rd person)
mueren: die, they die (Morir, present, 3rd person plural)

spanishExample: No moriste por la maldición en el juego.
englishTranslation: You didn’t die because of the curse in the game.
vocabIncluded: moriste: died, you died (Morir, preterite, 2nd person)

spanishExample: No quiero que mueras y no quiero que ella muera tampoco.
englishTranslation: I don’t want you to die and I don’t want her to die either.
vocabIncluded: "que", meaning "that" as a conjunction (even in cases where "that" disappears in English)
muera: die, he/she/it die (Morir, subjunctive, 3rd person)
mueras: die, you die (Morir, subjunctive, 2nd person)

spanishExample: No te pueden oír, tienen mucho sueño.
englishTranslation: They can’t hear you, they’re very sleepy.

spanishExample: No tienes que entender, pero él quiere que yo entienda.
englishTranslation: You don’t have to understand, but he wants me to understand.
vocabIncluded: "que", meaning "that" as a conjunction (even in cases where "that" disappears in English)
entienda: understand, I understand (Entender, subjunctive, 1st person)
using Tener with "que" to indicate obligation

spanishExample: No, por favor, quiero que entiendas.
englishTranslation: No, please, I want you to understand.
vocabIncluded: "que", meaning "that" as a conjunction (even in cases where "that" disappears in English)
entiendas: understand, you understand (Entender, subjunctive, 2nd person)

spanishExample: Podrían morir por la falta de comida y agua.
englishTranslation: They could die because of the lack of food and water.
vocabIncluded: podrían: "would be able", "they would be able" (Poder, conditional, 3rd person plural)

spanishExample: Por favor, no mueras, ahora entendemos.
englishTranslation: Please, don’t die, we understand now.
vocabIncluded: entendemos: understand, we understand (Entender, present, 1st person plural)

spanishExample: Quieren que entendamos que la falta de dinero es un problema.
englishTranslation: They want us to understand that the lack of money is a problem.
vocabIncluded: "que", meaning "that" as a conjunction (even in cases where "that" disappears in English)
entendamos: understand, we understand (Entender, subjunctive, 1st person plural)

spanishExample: Quince es mejor que doce, pero peor que once.
englishTranslation: Fifteen is better than twelve, but worse than eleven.

spanishExample: Quizás él no entienda que ella murió.
englishTranslation: Maybe he doesn’t understand that she died.
vocabIncluded: "que", meaning "that" as a conjunction (even in cases where "that" disappears in English)
entienda: understand, he/she/it understand (Entender, subjunctive, 3rd person)
murió: died , he/she/it died (Morir, preterite, 3rd person)

spanishExample: Quizás entiendan que fue un sueño y que no morimos.
englishTranslation: Maybe they understand it was a dream and we didn’t die.
vocabIncluded: "que", meaning "that" as a conjunction (even in cases where "that" disappears in English)
entiendan: understand, they understand (Entender, subjunctive, 3rd person plural)
morimos: died, we died (Morir, preterite, 1st person plural)

spanishExample: Si ella lo entiende, quizás yo no muera.
englishTranslation: If she understands it, maybe I won’t die.
vocabIncluded: entiende: understands, he/she/it understands (Entender, present, 3rd person)
muera: die, I die (Morir, subjunctive, 1st person)

spanishExample: Si mueres, no la vamos a oír.
englishTranslation: If you die, we’re not going to hear it(f).
vocabIncluded: mueres: die, you die (Morir, present, 2nd person)
using Ir and "a" to put verbs in the future (e.g. "voy a ser")
